headline: Elon Musk Says He Warned Donald Trump To Drop Tariffs Over Fears of Job Losses: 'President Loves Tariffs, I've Tried To Dissuade Him'
summary: Elon Musk has said that he failed in his attempts to convince President Donald Trump to hold back on implementing tariffs. What Happened: During an interview, Musk voiced his concerns about the potential market distortions caused by tariffs, which could lead to a recession and an increase in the prices of goods. headline: Morgan Stanley Hands Tesla Stock A New Rating, Sees Musk Hitting This Many Pay Deal Milestones
summary: Tesla received a price-target hike and a rating change from Morgan Stanley on Sunday as the analyst sees the automaker hitting several of the targets laid out in CEO Elon Musk's new pay package, valued at around $1 trillion.  TSLA shares fell in Monday's stock market.  Morgan Stanley analyst Andrew Percoco took over from Adam Jonas on Sunday and assumed coverage of Tesla stock with an equal weight rating, giving TSLA a 425 price target.

TSLA shares fell in Monday's stock market.  Morgan Stanley analyst Andrew Percoco took over from Adam Jonas on Sunday and assumed coverage of Tesla stock with an equal weight rating, giving TSLA a 425 price target.

headline: Tesla Stock Drops After Morgan Stanley Downgrade
summary: Tesla shares fell Monday after Morgan Stanley downgraded its rating for the stock, as well as for smaller electric-vehicle makers Rivian and Lucid.  The bank cut Tesla's stock to "equal weight," citing slower EV adoption and a choppy 12-month trading outlook, but raised its price target to $425, from $410.  Shares in Elon Musk's company dropped roughly 3% in morning trade.

raw.headline: Tesla Stock Drops After Morgan Stanley Downgrade
raw.summary: Tesla shares fell Monday after Morgan Stanley downgraded its rating for the stock, as well as for smaller electric-vehicle makers Rivian and Lucid.  The bank cut Tesla's stock to "equal weight," citing slower EV adoption and a choppy 12-month trading outlook, but raised its price target to $425, from $410.  Shares in Elon Musk's company dropped roughly 3% in morning trade.

headline: Tesla’s Sky High Valuation Prompts Morgan Stanley to Cut Rating
summary: Elon Musk is eager to transform Tesla Inc. into a robotics and artificial intelligence company, but the electric-vehicle maker's stock price already reflects those businesses and is at a “full valuation,” according to Morgan Stanley, which lowered its rating on the company to the equivalent of a hold, its first cut since June 2023. Tesla shares trade at about 210 times projected earnings over the next 12 months, making it the second most expensive company in S&P 500 Index, trailing just Warner Brothers Discovery Inc.

Tesla shares trade at about 210 times projected earnings over the next 12 months, making it the second most expensive company in S&P 500 Index, trailing just Warner Brothers Discovery Inc.

headline: IBM's $9.3B Confluent deal, WBD latest, Tesla downgrade
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman outlines three stories trending during Monday's trading session. IBM (IBM) is set to buy Confluent (CFLT) in a $9.3 billion deal. Paramount Skydance (PSKY) announced an all-cash offer to buy Warner Bros. (WBD), countering the recently announced Netflix (NFLX) deal. Morgan Stanley analysts downgraded Tesla (TSLA). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
